disasterPrograms.summary: Provides flood insurance to property owners, renters, and businesses. Franklin County participates. Most homeowners insurance does NOT cover flood damage. Coverage up to $250,000 for buildings and $100,000 for contents.
Look up your address to learn flood risk and Special Flood Hazard Areas. Maps show flood zones, floodplain boundaries, and base flood elevations.
Administers NFIP locally, sets minimum standards for floodplain development, and enforces regulations.
Statewide plan addressing flood hazards. 754 Ohio communities participate in NFIP with 23,661 policies covering $4.4 billion.
After presidential disaster declaration, provides grants for temporary housing, home repairs, and expenses. Apply within 60 days.
Low-interest loans for uninsured flood losses to homeowners, renters, and businesses.
Resources for flood recovery, insurance claims navigation, and financial preparedness.
Provides emergency shelter, food, health services, and recovery assistance.

disasterPrograms.programName: Franklin County Emergency Management & Homeland Security
disasterPrograms.summary: Primary county emergency management agency responsible for coordinating disaster preparation, response, and recovery within Franklin County.
Lead agency for city public health emergency response, managing health-related risks and community safety during disasters.
The sole federal point of contact for reporting all oil, chemical, radiological, biological and etiological discharges into the environment, available 24/7.
24/7 emergency line for reporting spills and releases of hazardous materials to the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency.
Provides 24/7 disaster assistance including emergency shelter, food, and emotional support for families affected by disasters.
Provides access to federal disaster assistance for individuals and businesses in areas with a Presidential disaster declaration.
A comprehensive information and referral service that connects residents with local resources and community services.
Provides 24/7, 365-day-a-year crisis counseling and support to people experiencing emotional distress related to natural or human-caused disasters.
Provides free legal help to low-income survivors of major disasters including assistance with insurance claims, home repair contracts, and landlord-tenant issues.
Grants for temporary housing, home repairs, and other disaster-related expenses. Apply online, by phone, or via FEMA app.
Financial aid to state/local governments and eligible nonprofits for emergency protective measures and infrastructure repair.
Low-interest loans for homeowners, renters, and businesses to cover uninsured property losses.

disasterPrograms.programName: USDA Farm Service Agency Emergency Loans
disasterPrograms.summary: Emergency credit for agricultural producers recovering from natural disasters. Covers equipment, livestock replacement, and farm reorganization.
Free legal assistance for disaster survivors with civil legal issues arising from presidentially-declared disasters.
Flood insurance for property owners, renters, and businesses. Coverage up to $250,000 for buildings and $100,000 for contents.
Special tax law provisions and deadline extensions for disaster-affected taxpayers.
Emergency food assistance for households affected by disasters who may not normally qualify for SNAP.
Financial assistance to local governments and eligible nonprofits for disaster response and recovery. Administered by Ohio EMA.
Coordinates state-level disaster preparedness, response, recovery, and mitigation. Five regional field offices.
Coordinates response to 5,000+ spills and facility incidents annually. Central District Office covers Franklin County.
Comprehensive disaster preparedness, response, and recovery information for Ohio residents.

disasterPrograms.programName: Ohio Department of Insurance Severe Weather Toolkit
disasterPrograms.summary: Resources for disaster recovery, insurance claims navigation, and financial preparedness.
Overarching county-level plan for all-hazards response, including chemical incidents and natural disasters.
Provides shelter, food, health/mental health services, and financial assistance to disaster victims. Serves Franklin and 8 other counties.

disasterPrograms.programName: Franklin County Public Health Emergency Preparedness
disasterPrograms.summary: PHEP program and Cities Readiness Initiative for biological/chemical incidents.
One-time emergency assistance for low-income families facing unexpected challenges.
County Auditor can reduce property values for storm-damaged properties. Form DTE 26 available.
Free information and referral service connecting residents to disaster assistance and human services.

disasterPrograms.programName: Clean Air Act Risk Management Program (RMP)
disasterPrograms.summary: Requires facilities using extremely hazardous substances to develop Risk Management Plans covering hazard assessment, worst-case scenarios, accident prevention, and emergency response.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.programName: Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act (EPCRA)
disasterPrograms.summary: Requires facilities to report hazardous chemical storage and releases to state/local planners and public. Established LEPCs.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: Safety management systems for workplaces with threshold quantities of highly hazardous chemicals to prevent catastrophic releases.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: Tracks approximately 650 toxic chemicals with public annual reports from facilities.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: Implements EPCRA in Ohio, creating SERC and requiring facilities to report releases within 30 minutes.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: Details release notification rules requiring verbal notification and written reports within 30 days.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: Air pollution control rules including accidental releases and air pollution episode procedures. Updated July 2025.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: Chemical Emergency Preparedness Advisory Council coordinates emergency planning and response. Maintains Regional Hazardous Materials Emergency Plan.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: Federal statute governing U.S. response to hazardous substance releases. EPA Regional Response Teams assist.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: Emergency Support Function 10 covers oil and hazardous materials response with intergovernmental coordination.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: Investigates major chemical accidents and provides prevention recommendations.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: 24/7 federal point of contact for reporting hazardous releases.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: Coordinates with responders on spills. Immediate reporting required to Spill Line. Written report within 30 days.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: Oversees LEPCs, ensures EPCRA reporting compliance. Based at Ohio EMA.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: Handles release response, coordinates with fire departments and Ohio EPA. Issues health advisories through FCPH.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: Handles on-scene response to releases within city limits. Fire Chief has primary authority per Ohio law.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: FCPH and MORPC use 36 PurpleAir sensors to track PM2.5 and ozone for real-time response planning. Columbus has 5 sensors downtown.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: Issues alerts when Air Quality Index reaches 101+. Used for response planning in high-risk areas.
disasterPrograms.disasterType: Accidental air toxic releases / hazardous materials

disasterPrograms.summary: Provides immediate severe weather warnings for tornadoes and severe thunderstorms.
Sends tornado warnings directly to mobile devices in affected areas.
Federal guidance on tornado preparedness, safe rooms, and response actions.
Presidential disaster declaration for 11 Ohio counties including Franklin County. Individual Assistance available for temporary housing, home repairs, and other needs.
Franklin County designated as contiguous county eligible for emergency agricultural loans after March 14, 2024 tornadoes. Contact local USDA Service Center.
Governor DeWine declared State of Emergency for 11 counties. Mobilized Ohio EMA, ODH, OSHP, ODOT, OhioMHAS, ODNR, and DAS.
Tax deadlines postponed to September 3, 2024 for Ohio tornado victims. Various disaster-related tax provisions available.
Free legal assistance for Ohio tornado survivors. Call 888-534-1432.
General tornado assistance after presidential declarations. Apply online, by phone (1-800-621-3362), or via app.
Emergency shelter, meals, financial assistance, and recovery support. Call 614-253-2740.
Available after presidential disaster declaration for earthquakes.
Low-interest loans for earthquake damage to homes and businesses.
Monitors earthquake activity in Ohio.
Programs including Emergency Conservation Program, Emergency Assistance for Livestock/Honeybees/Fish, Livestock Forage Disaster Program, and Tree Assistance Program.
Interactive tool to identify available drought assistance programs based on situation.
Helps eligible low-income households with heating and cooling costs during extreme temperatures.
Emergency cooling and warming centers opened during extreme temperature events.
Issues public health warnings during extreme heat events, coordinates with FCPH.
May be available after severe winter storms if presidential disaster is declared.

disasterPrograms.programName: American Red Cross Winter Storm Shelters
disasterPrograms.summary: Opens emergency shelters during severe winter weather events. Call 614-253-2740 or 1-800-733-2767.

emergencyContacts.organization: Franklin County Emergency Management & Homeland Security

emergencyContacts.notes: Free legal help for disaster survivors

emergencyContacts.summary: Accessible facilities where you can meet with FEMA representatives, ask questions, and learn about assistance programs.
Coordinates nonprofit, faith-based, and community organizations providing disaster services.
Free crisis counseling and support for people experiencing emotional distress related to disasters. 24/7 service.
Connects to local disaster assistance, emergency shelters, food banks, and other human services.
Provides home repairs for low-income homeowners, veterans, and disaster victims.
Real-time weather and emergency alerts, disaster news, and more.
Primary portal for applying for federal disaster assistance online.
